position.marginalia_text: Generales Professores, sine speciali praxi, aut certa necessariarum opum prouisione; moriuntur Mendici. Vt non modò Agrippa, et Turnebus, quanti philologi? = [*3[r]: = sed etiam Machiauellus, et Bodinus, quanti Politici? Tanti refert, solidè fundare rem familiarem: et a Teipso pendere: non ab amicis: qui nulli sunt egentibus. Contemnuntur pauperu[m] dignissimi: a[e]stimantur diuitu[m] indignissimi.]

marginalia.translation: General professors are without any special praxis or any particular foresight for necessary resources; they shall die poor. Is it not the same for Agrippa and Turnebus as philologists? [*3[r]: But even Machiavelli and Bodin, as Politicians? It is of much importance to build a solid foundation for the patrimony of your family and to depend on yourself, not on your friends, who need nothing. The worthiest of the poor are held in contempt, the unworthiest the wealthy are held in esteem.]

position.marginalia_text: Frustrà Sapit, qui Sibi non Sapit.

marginalia.translation: He who does not know himself knows in vain.

position.marginalia_text: Oportet regium professorem magna paruo operari: pra[e]sertim Methodo Solis pra[e]sentiss[im]a et praxe Solis potentiss[im]a.

marginalia.translation: It is necessary for the royal professor to work little at great things: especially with a single most favorable method and a single most powerful praxis.

position.marginalia_text: Quid habent heroici labores suprà hodiernas industrias?

marginalia.translation: Who holds heroic labors above daily industriousness?

position.marginalia_text: E semplice, chi e pouero? non e fino, chi non e ricco.
Heroicus animus. plus qu& heroica industria.
È semplice, chi è pouero: non è fino, chi non è ricco.
Vt s[upr]a de Nanna[e] panurgica Oeconomia.

marginalia.translation: Is the poor man simple? The rich man is not refined. A heroic spirit, more than heroic industriousness. Whoever is poor is simple; whoever is not rich is not refined. As above, concerning the panurgic economy of 'Nanna'.
